quest.name: The Darkness Below
journal: You can almost see the wheels turning in Alphinaud's head.
objectives: Speak with residents of the Ala Mhigan Quarter.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: If anyone can find that treasure, it's us─but even if we don't, the adventure will be reward enough, I reckon.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The news of Doma and Ala Mhigo's liberation has kindled the flames of revolution in every corner of the Empire. I hear the imperial province of Dalmasca has already risen up in rebellion...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Which means the Garleans must surely have their hands full. What better time than now to indulge in such a diversion? Tell us, Arenvald─have we any clues as to where we might begin our search?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Well, judging by how the other treasure hunters fared, nosing about the palace isn't like to get us anywhere, so...we'll probably need to, uh...ask around.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Would that be another way of saying “no”?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Well... Heh heh heh! Yes.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see. In that case, I shall pay a visit to the Allied archivists and request access to the records seized from the imperials.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Garleans are meticulous about such things. If they uncovered the trove during their occupation, the event is certain to have been recorded.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: In the meantime, the two of you can track down those who worked as palace servants and officials in Theodoric's day.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Given that they would have been at least twenty at the time, you will be looking for people who have seen forty summers or more. Anything they can tell you about the king and his bloody deeds may prove useful, so be sure to listen well.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Arenvald, pray try your luck in the Fringes and the Peaks whilst Forename makes the rounds in the Ala Mhigan Quarter.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Hah! And there I was thinking I was the party leader. Not that I mind, of course! Let's be about it, eh? We can meet afterwards at Gylbarde's Gate!

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEMAN
dialogue.text: ...In the palace? No, not me, lasslad.

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEMAN
dialogue.text: Surely you've heard stories of the mad king? He used to hold public executions up on the Divine Audience. Anyone─and I mean anyone─suspected of conspiring against the crown was flung from the top of those steps.

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEMAN
dialogue.text: Suffice it to say that I stayed as far away from the palace as possible.

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEMAN
dialogue.text: No, lasslad─I never set foot in the house of the King of Ruin. Who in their right mind would want to go anywhere near a man like him?

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEWOMAN
dialogue.text: You want to hear an old maid's stories, do you? Aye, well most of what I know of the mad king is common knowledge.

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEWOMAN
dialogue.text: We'd only see His Royal Majesty when he deigned to attend the executions he'd ordered. And after a while, even watching his “enemies” die wasn't enough to coax him out of hiding.

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEWOMAN
dialogue.text: They say he started seeing assassins in every shadow, and wouldn't set foot outside the palace walls. I was offered work there as a royal servant once, but the mere thought of it left me in a cold sweat...

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEWOMAN
dialogue.text: I was never desperate enough to accept a job at the palace. No amount of coin is worth your life.

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEHELLSGUARD
dialogue.text: ...Aye, I served at the pleasure of King Theodoric, and lived to tell the tale. One of the palace guards, I was.

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEHELLSGUARD
dialogue.text: Truth be told, it was a dark chapter in my life, and one I'd sooner forget. Hardly a night went by when we didn't hear bloodcurdling screams echoing from the inner chambers─which, of course, we were under orders to ignore.

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEHELLSGUARD
dialogue.text:
So we'd stand still as statues, trying not to imagine what horrors were unfolding within...
<sigh> If you're hells-bent on finding out what happened in the palace, head down the street here and ask old Ernold─he was the king's head scribe.

dialogue.name: MIDDLEAGEHELLSGUARD
dialogue.text: You'll find Ernold down that way. If any man was privy to the king's secrets, it was him.

dialogue.name: ERNOLD
dialogue.text: Yes, I am Ernold. ...What do you want with me?

dialogue.name: ERNOLD
dialogue.text: Hmmm, you would have me dredge up some decidedly unsavory memories. Yet if Ala Mhigo is to move forward, we must needs acknowledge the misdeeds of the past.

dialogue.name: ERNOLD
dialogue.text: Very well, I shall tell you what I remember. I take it you know of Theodoric's paranoia and the public executions of his kinsmen?

dialogue.name: ERNOLD
dialogue.text: Those were terrible enough. But in his last days, the king's fevered mind settled upon an even grislier method of “disposal” which only a chosen few were unfortunate enough to witness.

dialogue.name: ERNOLD
dialogue.text: His Majesty ordered the court thaumaturge to unleash a vile curse upon the remaining members of the royal family─a magic which transformed them into fiends of hideous aspect. The resulting...monstrosities were then cast into the darkness below the palace.

dialogue.name: ERNOLD
dialogue.text: Even now, my sleep is troubled by nightmares. If others of Theodoric's blood were prone to share his madness, then mayhap it is a kindness that the monarchy ended with him.

dialogue.name: ERNOLD
dialogue.text: It is my hope that Ala Mhigo shall never again suffer the likes of the King of Ruin. We forget at our peril...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, excellent timing as ever. We have but this moment returned from our own intelligence-gathering efforts.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Since we're all here, why don't we share what we've learned?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Allow me to begin, then. As promised, I scoured the imperial records for any mention of fantastic treasures...and found precisely none.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It is just possible, I suppose, that a corrupt official deliberately hid the fact of the trove's discovery, hoping to enrich himself─but I find it rather unlikely that so valuable a find would stay secret for long. I conclude that our prize either does not exist, or that the imperials somehow overlooked it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But what of you, Forename? Were your investigations any more fruitful?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Turned into monsters? And what could he mean by this “darkness beneath the palace,” I wonder...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I met an old man in Ala Ghiri who spoke of the palace's subterranean prison, but he said naught of cursed abominations!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The imperial archives were also silent on the subject of fiends inside the palace grounds.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Could this scribe fellow have been spinning herhim a yarn, do you think? Did you believe him, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Did you believe Ernold's tale?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: His fear seemed genuine.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He may have been lying...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: If he was afraid, that does lend credence to the tale─though I'm not sure how that helps us in our search.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Then we're back where we started...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Do not be so hasty─Ernold's anecdote may very well have told us where the trove is hidden. But ere I share my theory, there is a matter I would clarify.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Arenvald, you spoke of light-hearted adventure, but I sense a deeper motive for this expedition. Why are you so intent on finding this treasure?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: ...It wasn't all pretense, I swear it. But...you're right.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: My father was in the imperial army, a man of Garlean blood. I trust you know what I mean when I say that my Ala Mhigan mother did not welcome my arrival?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text:
As I grew, she would check my brow over and over, convinced that a spot on my skin was an emerging third eye─like the kind you see in pureblood Garleans. My mother did not care for this taunting reminder of my heritage, and took up a knife...
War paint serves to cover the scar.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: In the end, she turned me out into the street, and I was left to haunt the alleyways of Ala Mhigo, a feral child who got what he needed through begging, cunning, or worse.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: The best I can say about the years that followed is that I survived. But I hated the animal I'd become. Eventually, I left the city behind me, and joined a group of refugees bound for the other side of the Wall. It was then that I turned to adventuring, and that road led me into the company of the Scions.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I tell you this so that you understand: I know all too well what poverty and hunger can do to a person.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I drew steel on ordinary folk for a measly crust of bread. With Theodoric's gold, I could spare my countrymen the shame of living like that.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, Arenvald, and I apologize─that cannot have been pleasant to recall. But I felt it best to be clear in our intentions.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, Forename? Are you content to surrender the treasure to Arenvald's noble cause, and claim the thrill of adventure as your reward?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then I should be glad to tell you my theory on the resting place of the mad king's trove...if you are minded to hear it?
